Based on your preferences, I would highly recommend watching "The Equalizer" (2014) directed by Tony Scott.
The movie revolves around Jack Gruber (Denzel Washington), a former army intelligence officer who now runs his own private security company.
One day, Jack receives a call from a man named Michael (James Wilcox)), who claims to have found a young woman named Mala (Cybill Shepherd)) who he says has been abducted by a gang of kidnappers led by a man named Ratanlal (Peter Boyle)).
Mala is taken to an abandoned warehouse located on the outskirts of Los Angeles, California.
Inside the warehouse, Mala finds herself surrounded by several armed men and women who appear to be part of some criminal organization.
One of the men, a man named Raza (Harvey Keitel)) who appears to be in charge of the group, approaches Mala and says something to her.
However, at that moment, one of the other armed men, a man named Khan (Saïd Taghmaoui)) who appears to be operating independently of the group, steps forward and says something to Mala.
